intro: Williamsia loheri, commonly known as the Loher's willowscent, is a rare and endemic species native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry climates. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, spicy scent when crushed. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, Williamsia loheri is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
